intro: Scleria verticillata f. capillaris, commonly known as the slender-leaved泽兰, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its finely hairy leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance.
